Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog

Class CourseCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog.CourseCatalog
  • public class CourseCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Catalog of Course objects. Can load in courses to the Catalog from a file, add Courses to the Catalog, remove Courses from the Catalog. Also gets a specific Course from the Catalog or the entire Catalog. Also saves the Catalog to a text file.
    Author:
    Will Pressler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CourseCatalog()
      Constructor for an empty course catalog.

      Adds a course with the parameters to the Catalog.
      java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()

    • Method Detail

      • newCourseCatalog

        public void newCourseCatalog()
        Creates an empty course catalog when called.

      • loadCoursesFromFile

        public void loadCoursesFromFile​(java.lang.String filename)
        Loads in courses from a file to populate the course catalog.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename with courses
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be found

      • addCourseToCatalog

        public boolean addCourseToCatalog​(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String section,
                                  int credits,
                                  java.lang.String instructorId,
                                  int enrollmentCap,
                                  java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
        Adds a course with the parameters to the Catalog. Returns a boolean whether or not it was added successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - Course name
        title - Course title
        section - Course section
        credits - Course credits
        instructorId - the Course's instructor's id
        enrollmentCap - The maximum amount of students that can enroll into the Course
        meetingDays - Course meeting days
        startTime - Course starting time
        endTime - Course ending time
        Returns:
        boolean true if course is added, false if course is already in catalog

      • removeCourseFromCatalog

        public boolean removeCourseFromCatalog​(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String section)
        Removes a Course from the catalog. Returns true if the removal was successful, and false if the Course was not in the catalog to begin with.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the course to be removed
        section - the section of the course to be removed
        Returns:
        boolean true if the course removal was successful

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog​(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Gets a course from the catalog with the given name and section.
        Parameters:
        name - Course's name
        section - Course's section
        Returns:
        Course specified by name and section

      • getCourseCatalog

        public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
        Returns a 2D string array of the catalog, has a row for each course and columns for the name, section, and title. Returns an empty array if there are no courses in the catalog.
        Returns:
        courseCatalog array with course name, section, and title

      • saveCourseCatalog

        public void saveCourseCatalog​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the course catalog as a text file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file where the Course Catalog will be saved
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be saved
